page.title: 02Housing in Wolsingham
page.content: There are three main types of{housing in Wolsingham.The oldest houses are stone built with slates or pantiles. Some of these buildings are listed: {Demesne Hall,}the old rectory, stands in its own grounds,while{Bombay House is on the main road. { Lynndale}and{Ferndale}are Council estates,built in modern materials. {Lea Green}and{Riverdale}are two of the new private developments.At{Gateways, people have built their own homes. Wolsingham is a blend of old and new and has increased in size in recent years but without reaching the peak of population attained last century when {lead mining}was a major Weardale industry. Some older properties are neglected and are subject to{vandalism.
